name: Introduction to Sociology of Law
description: This course introduces students to the theories, methods, and research topics in sociology of law. It covers the historical development of the field, research methods used in the study of law, and the various approaches used to examine law in its social context.

name: Theoretical Foundations of Sociology of Law
description: This course provides an overview of the major theoretical frameworks used in sociology of law. It covers topics such as the relationship between law and society, the role of the legal system in the functioning of a society, the impact of legal institutions on behavioral patterns, and the role of legal regulation in the maintenance of social order.

name: Methods in Sociology of Law
description: This course covers the various methodologies used in sociology of law research, including quantitative methods, survey design, and qualitative methods. Students will be exposed to a range of research techniques, from the use of official data sources to the analysis of legal texts.
prerequisites: Theoretical Foundations of Sociology of Law

name: Advanced Sociology of Law
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the topics introduced in the introductory and theoretical courses. It covers topics such as the impact of legal changes on social behavior, the role of law in the control of social behavior, and the relationship between legal regulation and the functioning of the social system.
prerequisites: Theoretical Foundations of Sociology of Law
